page.title: 17CHURCH OF OGBOURNE ST ANDREW
page.content: { The church at Ogbourne St Andrew}is mainly Norman and Early English (transitional).It was Maud of Wallington who first instigated the building of the church.Many other parts have since been added to the original building.Most of the 5 bells were istalled in the 16th century. From 1583 there have been 31{vicars including the present one.He is a retired bishop called Bishop James Adams.He has been in charge of the parish for 6 months now.There is a {congregation}of 28 members who live in Ogbourne St Andrew and the surrounding villages of Ogbourne Maizey and Rockley.In the{graveyard}near the church is a tumulus or burial mound. The churchyard and graves themselves are very well kept.There are about 160 gravestones in the graveyard, the oldest dating from 1630.
